# Welcome!

-   the language of instruction is English
-   Block course:
    -   April 12-14 (10am-4pm)
    -   June 30th (2-6pm)
    -   July 1st (10am-4pm)
    
## Course description

- skills and know-how needed to 
  + create reproducible **reports & presentations** of eye-tracking reading data
  + common measures in **eye-tracking reading**
  + importance of **reproducible workflow**
  + **communicate** findings

- hands-on exercises in RStudio with the R programming language
  + data **wrangling** (tidyverse)
  + data **visualisation** (ggplot2), 
  + descriptive and inferential **statistics**
  
## Course credits

- 4 LP
  + attendance and participation: 1LP
  + Exercises: 1LP
  + Assignments: 2 LP
    1. Reproducible (pilot) data report + Pre-registration
    2. Reproducible analysis report

# Reading list

-   this course does not have a heavy reading load, but a few readings are required:
    -   @biondo_yesterday_2022; @laurinavichyute_share_2022; @vasishth_what_2013; @vasishth_statistical_2016-1

## Recommended readings

- there are lots of useful resources out there, specifically:
  + anything from Bodo Winter, but especially: @winter_linear_nodate; @winter_very_2014; @winter_statistics_2019
  + the [PsyTeachR](https://psyteachr.github.io/) website is a *great* resource
